body: I am seeing similar issues on Ubuntu. I had had to clear the ShaDA folder multiple times since around a week or so ago

I've seen the same error message frequently since around v0.11 (nightly/build from master) but also before that. A plugin that I use write shada on VimLeave. I see https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/8587 when running Neovim on Windows 11 and wonder if there is a link with that shada error at least in some instances. I am not sure why those tmp-files are used in the first place.
Seeing the same issue on the same version (NVIM v0.11.0-dev-168+ge20c5fba2) on Windows

~~for me, removing `AppData/Local/nvim-data/shada` folder resolved the problem~~

Edit: but then i still see the same error after a while. i think neovim saving the file in wrong format

some relatively recent changes to reading/writing shada was https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/29093 and https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/29016 (more likely the former causing issues at is is a more complex refactor)

I'm also getting this, but only on Windows, and it seems to be a _read_ issue not a _write_ issue - if I copy the `main.shada` file that was giving E576 errors over to WSL, it works without issue. Reverting to the v0.10 release also works correctly, with that same `main.shada` file.

I'm using the latest git commit on WSL (d7651b2) and the latest nightly on Windows (f69937fdb).
@bfredl Just did a bisect, and I can confirm the first bad commit is indeed 7e44ab696a0488ad234b0915a8cf804fd6d79156 (#29093).

issue.title: fix(fileio): copy to correct buffer position when reading

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

body: @AThePeanut4 would you mind try https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/29221 and see if it helps?

I think this issue also affects stable 0.10.0....
I was experiencing it a lot but haven't since I'm building from source
@melMass This issue did begin around a week ago (after 0.10 release), so then I think that there is another issue on 0.10. Do you have any logs?

Sorry I don't, I wiped everything in nvim-data multiple time to isolate the issue and don't have it since I'm using nightly. I had the bug since I updated to 0.10 but just got the habit to remove those extra shada when it happened!
